title: United Airlines Says Omicron Variant to Slow Travel Rebound
sub_head: Carrier is scaling back its schedule amid falloff in demand, but says setback will be temporary
body:
United Airlines Holdings Inc. said the emergence of the Omicron variant of Covid-19 dented near-term bookings and will slow its recovery, but said the setback is likely to be temporary.
The Chicago-based airline is scaling back its schedule in the first months of the year as it grapples with the new variantâ€™s impact on travel demand. United said it now expects to fly less this year than it did in 2019, instead of the 5% growth it had previously anticipated.
